main event: Three persons spotted a 6 to 10 feet in diameter unidentified aerial object hovering about 10 feet above the ground in Bliss, Idaho. The object climbed to about 1000 feet, hovered for about one minute, and then flew south for approximately 10 miles before heading in a southwesterly direction.
interesting points: The object was described as 6 to 10 feet in diameter and was observed hovering about 10 feet above the ground.
After the witnesses approached the object, it climbed to about 1000 feet and hovered for about a minute before flying south and then southwest.
Three witnesses approached the object on foot, and 1-3/4 color photographs of the object were taken, but they have not yet been developed.
The object was described to have no apparent means of propulsion other than spinning.
The weather report for the area indicates a possible lack of authenticity in reporting the sighting.
photographs: Photographs were taken but not yet developed
